BotAliasLocaleSettingsList.description: A list of bot alias locale settings to add to the bot alias.

properties.name: LocaleId
properties.description: A string used to identify the locale

type.description: A string used to identify the locale

BotAliasLocaleSettings.description: You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.description: Whether the Lambda code hook is enabled

type.description: Whether the Lambda code hook is enabled

CodeHookSpecification.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

LambdaCodeHook.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

properties.name: CodeHookInterfaceVersion
properties.description: The version of the request-response that you want Amazon Lex to use to invoke your Lambda function.

type.description: The version of the request-response that you want Amazon Lex to use to invoke your Lambda function.

properties.name: LambdaArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

ConversationLogSettings.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

AudioLogSettings.description: List of audio log settings that pertain to the conversation log settings for the bot's TestBotAlias.

TextLogSettings.description: List of text log settings that pertain to the conversation log settings for the bot's TestBotAlias

AudioLogSetting.description: Settings for logging audio of conversations between Amazon Lex and a user. You specify whether to log audio and the Amazon S3 bucket where the audio file is stored.

TextLogSetting.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

AudioLogDestination.description: The location of audio log files collected when conversation logging is enabled for a bot.

TextLogDestination.description: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs destination log group for conversation text logs.

properties.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
properties.description: A string used to identify the groupArn for the Cloudwatch Log Group

type.description: A string used to identify the groupArn for the Cloudwatch Log Group

properties.name: LogPrefix
properties.description: A string containing the value for the Log Prefix

type.description: A string containing the value for the Log Prefix

S3BucketLogDestination.description: Specifies an Amazon S3 bucket for logging audio conversations

properties.name: S3BucketArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket where audio log files are stored.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket where audio log files are stored.

properties.name: LogPrefix
properties.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

type.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

properties.name: KmsKeyArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting audio log files stored in an S3 bucket.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting audio log files stored in an S3 bucket.

TestBotAliasSettings.description: Configuring the test bot alias settings for a given bot

properties.name: SentimentAnalysisSettings
properties.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

type.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

properties.name: DetectSentiment
properties.description: Enable to call Amazon Comprehend for Sentiment natively within Lex

type.description: Enable to call Amazon Comprehend for Sentiment natively within Lex

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

DataPrivacy.description: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

properties.name: ChildDirected
properties.description: Specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA).

type.description: Specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA).

IdleSessionTTLInSeconds.description: The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

Utterance.description: The sample utterance that Amazon Lex uses to build its machine-learning model to recognize intents/slots.

SampleUtterance.description: A sample utterance that invokes an intent or respond to a slot elicitation prompt.

Tag.description: A key-value pair for tagging Lex resources

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

LocaleId.description: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in.

VoiceSettings.description: Settings for using an Amazon Polly voice to communicate with a user.

properties.name: VoiceId
properties.description: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

type.description: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

properties.name: Engine
properties.description: Indicates the type of Amazon Polly voice that Amazon Lex should use for voice interaction with the user. For more information, see the engine parameter of the SynthesizeSpeech operation in the Amazon Polly developer guide.

type.description: Indicates the type of Amazon Polly voice that Amazon Lex should use for voice interaction with the user. For more information, see the engine parameter of the SynthesizeSpeech operation in the Amazon Polly developer guide.

ConfidenceThreshold.description: The specified confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents.

ParentIntentSignature.description: A unique identifier for the built-in intent to base this intent on.

DialogCodeHookSetting.description: Settings that determine the Lambda function that Amazon Lex uses for processing user responses.

FulfillmentStartResponseSpecification.description: Provides settings for a message that is sent to the user when a fulfillment Lambda function starts running.

properties.name: DelayInSeconds
properties.description: The delay between when the Lambda fulfillment function starts running and the start message is played. If the Lambda function returns before the delay is over, the start message isn't played.

type.description: The delay between when the Lambda fulfillment function starts running and the start message is played. If the Lambda function returns before the delay is over, the start message isn't played.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt the start message while it is playing.

type.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt the start message while it is playing.

FulfillmentUpdateResponseSpecification.description: Provides settings for a message that is sent periodically to the user while a fulfillment Lambda function is running.

properties.name: FrequencyInSeconds
properties.description: The frequency that a message is sent to the user. When the period ends, Amazon Lex chooses a message from the message groups and plays it to the user. If the fulfillment Lambda returns before the first period ends, an update message is not played to the user.

type.description: The frequency that a message is sent to the user. When the period ends, Amazon Lex chooses a message from the message groups and plays it to the user. If the fulfillment Lambda returns before the first period ends, an update message is not played to the user.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt an update message while it is playing.

type.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt an update message while it is playing.

FulfillmentUpdatesSpecification.description: Provides information for updating the user on the progress of fulfilling an intent.

properties.name: TimeoutInSeconds
properties.description: The length of time that the fulfillment Lambda function should run before it times out.

type.description: The length of time that the fulfillment Lambda function should run before it times out.

properties.name: Active
properties.description: Determines whether fulfillment updates are sent to the user. When this field is true, updates are sent.

type.description: Determines whether fulfillment updates are sent to the user. When this field is true, updates are sent.

PostFulfillmentStatusSpecification.description: Provides a setting that determines whether the post-fulfillment response is sent to the user.

properties.name: SuccessResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: SuccessNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step in the conversation that Amazon Lex invokes when the fulfillment code hook completes successfully.

type.description: Specifies the next step in the conversation that Amazon Lex invokes when the fulfillment code hook completes successfully.

properties.name: SuccessConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook finishes successfully.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook finishes successfully.

properties.name: FailureResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: FailureNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

type.description: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

properties.name: FailureConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

properties.name: TimeoutResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: TimeoutNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the fulfillment code hook times out.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the fulfillment code hook times out.

properties.name: TimeoutConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the fulfillment code hook times out.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the fulfillment code hook times out.

FulfillmentCodeHookSetting.description: Settings that determine if a Lambda function should be invoked to fulfill a specific intent.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Determines whether the fulfillment code hook is used. When active is false, the code hook doesn't run.

type.description: Determines whether the fulfillment code hook is used. When active is false, the code hook doesn't run.

Button.description: A button to use on a response card used to gather slot values from a user.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The text that appears on the button.

type.description: The text that appears on the button.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button.

type.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button.

ImageResponseCard.description: A message that defines a response card that the client application can show to the user.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: The title to display on the response card.

type.description: The title to display on the response card.

properties.name: Subtitle
properties.description: The subtitle to display on the response card.

type.description: The subtitle to display on the response card.

properties.name: ImageUrl
properties.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card.

type.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card.

properties.name: Buttons
properties.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card.

type.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card.

PlainTextMessage.description: A message in plain text format.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The message to send to the user.

type.description: The message to send to the user.

CustomPayload.description: A message in a custom format defined by the client application.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The string that is sent to your application.

type.description: The string that is sent to your application.

SSMLMessage.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

type.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

Message.description: The primary message that Amazon Lex should send to the user.

MessageGroup.description: One or more messages that Amazon Lex can send to the user.

properties.name: Variations
properties.description: Message variations to send to the user.

type.description: Message variations to send to the user.

MessageGroupsList.description: One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

PromptMaxRetries.description: The maximum number of times the bot tries to elicit a response from the user using this prompt.

MessageSelectionStrategy.description: Indicates how a message is selected from a message group among retries.

properties.name: AllowAudioInput
properties.description: Indicates whether audio input is allowed.

type.description: Indicates whether audio input is allowed.

properties.name: AllowDTMFInput
properties.description: Indicates whether DTMF input is allowed.

type.description: Indicates whether DTMF input is allowed.

DTMFSpecification.description: Specifies the settings on DTMF input.

properties.name: DeletionCharacter
properties.description: The DTMF character that clears the accumulated DTMF digits and immediately ends the input.

type.description: The DTMF character that clears the accumulated DTMF digits and immediately ends the input.

properties.name: EndCharacter
properties.description: The DTMF character that immediately ends input. If the user does not press this character, the input ends after the end timeout.

type.description: The DTMF character that immediately ends input. If the user does not press this character, the input ends after the end timeout.

properties.name: EndTimeoutMs
properties.description: How long the bot should wait after the last DTMF character input before assuming that the input has concluded.

type.description: How long the bot should wait after the last DTMF character input before assuming that the input has concluded.

properties.name: MaxLength
properties.description: The maximum number of DTMF digits allowed in an utterance.

type.description: The maximum number of DTMF digits allowed in an utterance.

properties.name: EndTimeoutMs
properties.description: Time for which a bot waits after the customer stops speaking to assume the utterance is finished.

type.description: Time for which a bot waits after the customer stops speaking to assume the utterance is finished.

properties.name: MaxLengthMs
properties.description: Time for how long Amazon Lex waits before speech input is truncated and the speech is returned to application.

type.description: Time for how long Amazon Lex waits before speech input is truncated and the speech is returned to application.

AudioAndDTMFInputSpecification.description: Specifies the audio and DTMF input specification.

properties.name: StartTimeoutMs
properties.description: Time for which a bot waits before assuming that the customer isn't going to speak or press a key. This timeout is shared between Audio and DTMF inputs.

type.description: Time for which a bot waits before assuming that the customer isn't going to speak or press a key. This timeout is shared between Audio and DTMF inputs.

properties.name: StartTimeoutMs
properties.description: Time for which a bot waits before re-prompting a customer for text input.

type.description: Time for which a bot waits before re-prompting a customer for text input.

PromptAttemptSpecification.description: Specifies the settings on a prompt attempt.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt attempt from the bot.

type.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt attempt from the bot.

PromptSpecification.description: Prompts the user to confirm the intent.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

type.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

properties.name: PromptAttemptsSpecification
properties.description: Specifies the advanced settings on each attempt of the prompt.

type.description: Specifies the advanced settings on each attempt of the prompt.

ResponseSpecification.description: A list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

type.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

StillWaitingResponseFrequency.description: How often a message should be sent to the user in seconds.

StillWaitingResponseTimeout.description: If Amazon Lex waits longer than this length of time in seconds for a response, it will stop sending messages.

properties.name: AllowInterrupt
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

type.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

IntentConfirmationSetting.description: Provides a prompt for making sure that the user is ready for the intent to be fulfilled.

properties.name: PromptSpecification
properties.description: Prompts the user to confirm the intent. This question should have a yes or no answer.

type.description: Prompts the user to confirm the intent. This question should have a yes or no answer.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Specifies whether the intent's confirmation is sent to the user. When this field is false, confirmation and declination responses aren't sent. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

type.description: Specifies whether the intent's confirmation is sent to the user. When this field is false, confirmation and declination responses aren't sent. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

properties.name: ConfirmationResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: ConfirmationNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes when the customer confirms the intent.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes when the customer confirms the intent.

properties.name: ConfirmationConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the intent is closed.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the intent is closed.

properties.name: DeclinationResponse
properties.description: When the user answers "no" to the question defined in promptSpecification, Amazon Lex responds with this response to acknowledge that the intent was canceled.

type.description: When the user answers "no" to the question defined in promptSpecification, Amazon Lex responds with this response to acknowledge that the intent was canceled.

properties.name: DeclinationNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes when the customer declines the intent.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes when the customer declines the intent.

properties.name: DeclinationConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the intent is declined.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the intent is declined.

properties.name: FailureResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: FailureNextStep
properties.description: The next step to take in the conversation if the confirmation step fails.

type.description: The next step to take in the conversation if the confirmation step fails.

properties.name: FailureConditional
properties.description: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

type.description: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

properties.name: CodeHook
properties.description: The DialogCodeHookInvocationSetting object associated with intent's confirmation step. The dialog code hook is triggered based on these invocation settings when the confirmation next step or declination next step or failure next step is InvokeDialogCodeHook.

type.description: The DialogCodeHookInvocationSetting object associated with intent's confirmation step. The dialog code hook is triggered based on these invocation settings when the confirmation next step or declination next step or failure next step is InvokeDialogCodeHook.

properties.name: ElicitationCodeHook
properties.description: The DialogCodeHookInvocationSetting used when the code hook is invoked during confirmation prompt retries.

type.description: The DialogCodeHookInvocationSetting used when the code hook is invoked during confirmation prompt retries.

IntentClosingSetting.description: Provides a statement the Amazon Lex conveys to the user when the intent is successfully fulfilled.

properties.name: ClosingResponse
properties.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is complete.

type.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is complete.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Specifies whether an intent's closing response is used. When this field is false, the closing response isn't sent to the user. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

type.description: Specifies whether an intent's closing response is used. When this field is false, the closing response isn't sent to the user. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

properties.name: Conditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches associated with the intent's closing response. These branches are executed when the nextStep attribute is set to EvalutateConditional.

type.description: A list of conditional branches associated with the intent's closing response. These branches are executed when the nextStep attribute is set to EvalutateConditional.

properties.name: NextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes after playing the intent's closing response.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot executes after playing the intent's closing response.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the context.

type.description: The name of the context.

InputContextsList.description: The list of input contexts specified for the intent.

ContextTimeToLiveInSeconds.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the output context should remain active.

ContextTurnsToLive.description: The number of conversation turns that the output context should remain active.

OutputContext.description: A session context that is activated when an intent is fulfilled.

OutputContextsList.description: A list of contexts that the intent activates when it is fulfilled.

KendraIndexArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kendra index that you want the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to search.

QueryFilterString.description: A query filter that Amazon Lex sends to Amazon Kendra to filter the response from a query.

KendraConfiguration.description: Configuration for searching a Amazon Kendra index specified for the intent.

properties.name: QueryFilterStringEnabled
properties.description: Determines whether the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent uses a custom query string to query the Amazon Kendra index.

type.description: Determines whether the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent uses a custom query string to query the Amazon Kendra index.

PriorityValue.description: The priority that a slot should be elicited.

SlotPriority.description: The priority that Amazon Lex should use when eliciting slot values from a user.

properties.name: SlotName
properties.description: The name of the slot.

type.description: The name of the slot.

Intent.description: Represents an action that the user wants to perform.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the intent.

type.description: The name of the intent.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Description of thr intent.

type.description: Description of thr intent.

properties.name: SampleUtterances
properties.description: A sample utterance that invokes an intent or respond to a slot elicitation prompt.

type.description: A sample utterance that invokes an intent or respond to a slot elicitation prompt.

properties.name: InitialResponseSetting
properties.description: Configuration setting for a response sent to the user before Amazon Lex starts eliciting slots.

type.description: Configuration setting for a response sent to the user before Amazon Lex starts eliciting slots.

properties.name: Slots
properties.description: List of slots

type.description: List of slots

ParentSlotTypeSignature.description: The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type.

SlotTypeName.description: The slot type name that is used in the slot. Allows for custom and built-in slot type names

SampleValue.description: Defines one of the values for a slot type.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

type.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

SynonymList.description: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

SlotTypeValue.description: Value that the slot type can take.

SlotTypeValues.description: A List of slot type values

SlotValueRegexFilter.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

properties.name: Pattern
properties.description: Regex pattern

type.description: Regex pattern

AudioRecognitionStrategy.description: Enables using slot values as a custom vocabulary when recognizing user utterances.

AdvancedRecognitionSetting.description: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values.

SlotValueSelectionSetting.description: Contains settings used by Amazon Lex to select a slot value.

GrammarSlotTypeSource.description: Describes the Amazon S3 bucket name and location for the grammar that is the source for the slot type.

properties.name: S3BucketName
properties.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

type.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

properties.name: S3ObjectKey

properties.description: The Amazon KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

GrammarSlotTypeSetting.description: Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide.

ExternalSourceSetting.description: Provides information about the external source of the slot type's definition.

SlotType.description: A custom, extended built-in or a grammar slot type.

CustomVocabularyItem.description: A custom vocabulary item that contains the phrase to recognize and a weight to give the boost.

properties.name: Phrase
properties.description: Phrase that should be recognized.

type.description: Phrase that should be recognized.

properties.name: Weight
properties.description: The degree to which the phrase recognition is boosted. The weight 0 means that no boosting will be applied and the entry will only be used for performing replacements using the displayAs field.

type.description: The degree to which the phrase recognition is boosted. The weight 0 means that no boosting will be applied and the entry will only be used for performing replacements using the displayAs field.

properties.name: DisplayAs
properties.description: Defines how you want your phrase to look in your transcription output.

type.description: Defines how you want your phrase to look in your transcription output.

CustomVocabulary.description: A custom vocabulary is a list of specific phrases that you want Amazon Lex V2 to recognize in the audio input.

SlotDefaultValue.description: The default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

properties.name: DefaultValue
properties.description: The default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

type.description: The default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

properties.description: A list of slot default values

type.description: A list of slot default values

WaitAndContinueSpecification.description: The prompts that Amazon Lex uses while a bot is waiting for customer input.

properties.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is waiting for the conversation to continue.

type.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is waiting for the conversation to continue.

properties.name: ContinueResponse

type.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is ready to continue the conversation.

properties.name: StillWaitingResponse
properties.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends periodically to the user to indicate that the bot is still waiting for input from the user.

type.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends periodically to the user to indicate that the bot is still waiting for input from the user.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Specifies whether the bot will wait for a user to respond.

type.description: Specifies whether the bot will wait for a user to respond.

SlotValueElicitationSetting.description: Settings that you can use for eliciting a slot value.

properties.name: DefaultValueSpecification
properties.description: A list of default values for a slot.

type.description: A list of default values for a slot.

properties.name: SlotConstraint
properties.description: Specifies whether the slot is required or optional.

type.description: Specifies whether the slot is required or optional.

properties.name: PromptSpecification
properties.description: The prompt that Amazon Lex uses to elicit the slot value from the user.

type.description: The prompt that Amazon Lex uses to elicit the slot value from the user.

properties.name: SampleUtterances
properties.description: If you know a specific pattern that users might respond to an Amazon Lex request for a slot value, you can provide those utterances to improve accuracy.

type.description: If you know a specific pattern that users might respond to an Amazon Lex request for a slot value, you can provide those utterances to improve accuracy.

properties.name: WaitAndContinueSpecification
properties.description: Specifies the prompts that Amazon Lex uses while a bot is waiting for customer input.

type.description: Specifies the prompts that Amazon Lex uses while a bot is waiting for customer input.

properties.name: SlotCaptureSetting
properties.description: Specifies the next stage in the conversation after capturing the slot.

type.description: Specifies the next stage in the conversation after capturing the slot.

ObfuscationSetting.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex obscures slot values in conversation logs.

properties.name: ObfuscationSettingType
properties.description: Value that determines whether Amazon Lex obscures slot values in conversation logs. The default is to obscure the values.

type.description: Value that determines whether Amazon Lex obscures slot values in conversation logs. The default is to obscure the values.

MultipleValuesSetting.description: Indicates whether a slot can return multiple values.

Slot.description: A slot is a variable needed to fulfill an intent, where an intent can require zero or more slots.

BotLocale.description: A locale in the bot, which contains the intents and slot types that the bot uses in conversations with users in the specified language and locale.

properties.description: List of SlotTypes

type.description: List of SlotTypes

S3Location.description: S3 location of bot definitions zip file, if it's not defined inline in CloudFormation.

properties.name: S3Bucket
properties.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

type.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

properties.name: S3ObjectKey
properties.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

type.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

properties.name: S3ObjectVersion
properties.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use. If not specified, the current object version will be used.

type.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use. If not specified, the current object version will be used.

Condition.description: Provides an expression that evaluates to true or false.

properties.name: ExpressionString
properties.description: The expression string that is evaluated.

type.description: The expression string that is evaluated.

Conditional.description: Contains conditional branches to fork the conversation flow.

ConditionalSpecification.description: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Determines whether a conditional branch is active. When active is false, the conditions are not evaluated.

type.description: Determines whether a conditional branch is active. When active is false, the conditions are not evaluated.

properties.name: ConditionalBranches
properties.description: A list of conditional branches. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step. The response and next step are executed when the condition is true.

type.description: A list of conditional branches. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step. The response and next step are executed when the condition is true.

properties.name: DefaultBranch
properties.description: The conditional branch that should be followed when the conditions for other branches are not satisfied. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step.

type.description: The conditional branch that should be followed when the conditions for other branches are not satisfied. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step.

DefaultConditionalBranch.description: A set of actions that Amazon Lex should run if none of the other conditions are met.

properties.name: NextStep
properties.description: The next step in the conversation.

type.description: The next step in the conversation.

properties.name: Response
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

ConditionalBranch.description: A set of actions that Amazon Lex should run if the condition is matched.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the branch.

type.description: The name of the branch.

properties.name: Condition
properties.description: Contains the expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the branch's actions are taken.

type.description: Contains the expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the branch's actions are taken.

properties.name: NextStep
properties.description: The next step in the conversation.

type.description: The next step in the conversation.

properties.name: Response
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

ConditionalBranches.description: A list of 1 to 4 conditional branches to fork the conversation flow.

InitialResponseSetting.description: Configuration setting for a response sent to the user before Amazon Lex starts eliciting slots.

properties.name: InitialResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: NextStep
properties.description: The next step in the conversation.

type.description: The next step in the conversation.

properties.name: Conditional
properties.description: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

type.description: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

properties.name: CodeHook
properties.description: Settings that specify the dialog code hook that is called by Amazon Lex at a step of the conversation.

type.description: Settings that specify the dialog code hook that is called by Amazon Lex at a step of the conversation.

ConditionExpression.description: Expression that is evaluated to true or false at runtime.

DialogCodeHookInvocationSetting.description: Settings that specify the dialog code hook that is called by Amazon Lex at a step of the conversation.

properties.name: EnableCodeHookInvocation
properties.description: Indicates whether a Lambda function should be invoked for the dialog.

type.description: Indicates whether a Lambda function should be invoked for the dialog.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Determines whether a dialog code hook is used when the intent is activated.

type.description: Determines whether a dialog code hook is used when the intent is activated.

properties.name: InvocationLabel
properties.description: A label that indicates the dialog step from which the dialog code hook is happening.

type.description: A label that indicates the dialog step from which the dialog code hook is happening.

properties.name: PostCodeHookSpecification
properties.description: Contains the responses and actions that Amazon Lex takes after the Lambda function is complete.

type.description: Contains the responses and actions that Amazon Lex takes after the Lambda function is complete.

ElicitationCodeHookInvocationSetting.description: Settings that specify the dialog code hook that is called by Amazon Lex between eliciting slot values.

properties.name: EnableCodeHookInvocation
properties.description: Indicates whether a Lambda function should be invoked for the dialog.

type.description: Indicates whether a Lambda function should be invoked for the dialog.

properties.name: InvocationLabel
properties.description: A label that indicates the dialog step from which the dialog code hook is happening.

type.description: A label that indicates the dialog step from which the dialog code hook is happening.

PostDialogCodeHookInvocationSpecificatio.description: Specifies next steps to run after the dialog code hook finishes.

properties.name: SuccessResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: SuccessNextStep
properties.description: Specifics the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

type.description: Specifics the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

properties.name: SuccessConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

properties.name: FailureResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: FailureNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

type.description: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

properties.name: FailureConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

properties.name: TimeoutResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: TimeoutNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the code hook times out.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the code hook times out.

properties.name: TimeoutConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the code hook times out.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the code hook times out.

DialogState.description: The current state of the conversation with the user.

properties.name: DialogAction
properties.description: Defines the action that the bot executes at runtime when the conversation reaches this step.

type.description: Defines the action that the bot executes at runtime when the conversation reaches this step.

properties.name: Intent
properties.description: Override settings to configure the intent state.

type.description: Override settings to configure the intent state.

properties.name: SessionAttributes
properties.description: List of session attributes to be applied when the conversation reaches this step.

type.description: List of session attributes to be applied when the conversation reaches this step.

DialogAction.description: Defines the action that the bot executes at runtime when the conversation reaches this step.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The action that the bot should execute.

type.description: The action that the bot should execute.

properties.name: SlotToElicit
properties.description: If the dialog action is ElicitSlot, defines the slot to elicit from the user.

type.description: If the dialog action is ElicitSlot, defines the slot to elicit from the user.

properties.name: SuppressNextMessage
properties.description: When true the next message for the intent is not used.

type.description: When true the next message for the intent is not used.

DialogActionType.description: The possible values of actions that the conversation can take.

SessionAttribute.description: Key/value pair representing session-specific context information. It contains application information passed between Amazon Lex and a client application.

IntentOverride.description: Override settings to configure the intent state.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the intent. Only required when you're switching intents.

type.description: The name of the intent. Only required when you're switching intents.

properties.name: Slots
properties.description: A map of all of the slot value overrides for the intent.

type.description: A map of all of the slot value overrides for the intent.

SlotValueOverrideMap.description: A map of slot names and their overridden values.

SlotValueOverride.description: The slot values that Amazon Lex uses when it sets slot values in a dialog step.

properties.name: Shape
properties.description: When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value.

type.description: When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The current value of the slot.

type.description: The current value of the slot.

properties.name: Values
properties.description: A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be "pepperoni" and "pineapple."

type.description: A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be "pepperoni" and "pineapple."

SlotValue.description: The value to set in a slot.

properties.name: InterpretedValue
properties.description: The value that Amazon Lex determines for the slot.

type.description: The value that Amazon Lex determines for the slot.

SlotValues.description: An array of values that slots should be set to

SlotShape.description: The different shapes that a slot can be in during a conversation.

SlotCaptureSetting.description: Settings used when Amazon Lex successfully captures a slot value from a user.

properties.name: CaptureResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: CaptureNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value is captured before the code hook times out.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value is captured before the code hook times out.

properties.name: CaptureConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the slot value is captured.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the slot value is captured.

properties.name: FailureResponse
properties.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

type.description: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

properties.name: FailureNextStep
properties.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value code is not recognized.

type.description: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value code is not recognized.

properties.name: FailureConditional
properties.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate when the slot value isn't captured.

type.description: A list of conditional branches to evaluate when the slot value isn't captured.

properties.name: CodeHook
properties.description: Code hook called after Amazon Lex successfully captures a slot value.

type.description: Code hook called after Amazon Lex successfully captures a slot value.

properties.name: ElicitationCodeHook
properties.description: Code hook called when Amazon Lex doesn't capture a slot value.

type.description: Code hook called when Amazon Lex doesn't capture a slot value.

resource.description: Amazon Lex conversational bot performing automated tasks such as ordering a pizza, booking a hotel, and so on.

properties.name: DataPrivacy
properties.description: Data privacy setting of the Bot.

type.description: Data privacy setting of the Bot.

properties.name: IdleSessionTTLInSeconds
properties.description: IdleSessionTTLInSeconds of the resource

properties.name: BotLocales
properties.description: List of bot locales

type.description: List of bot locales

properties.name: BotTags
properties.description: A list of tags to add to the bot, which can only be added at bot creation.

type.description: A list of tags to add to the bot, which can only be added at bot creation.

properties.name: TestBotAliasTags
properties.description: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot, , which can only be added at bot/bot alias creation.

type.description: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot, , which can only be added at bot/bot alias creation.

properties.name: AutoBuildBotLocales
properties.description: Specifies whether to build the bot locales after bot creation completes.

type.description: Specifies whether to build the bot locales after bot creation completes.
